intro: Monnina mollis, commonly known as silky blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing annual or perennial herb with slender, hairy stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant has alternate, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Monnina mollis is known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
